page.title: 05Traffic Parking Stirling
page.content: Stirling has a great many shops and there are many traffic problems. These problems mainly occur on Saturdays and holidays in other towns. To cope with these problems there are 10 car parks in the centre of the town. There are many parking meters in the streets nearby but every year more and more parking meters spread to streets that didn't have them before. In the very centre of the town it costs 15p for half an hour. Further from the centre it may cost 15p for two hours or even the whole day! The traffic wardens patrolling the streets help with the problems such as roadworks, parades, people parking where they should not and traffic jams. If you go into town on a Saturday it is unlikely you will find a space in the very centre unless you go early in the morning.
